title: What to Know About Israel’s Strikes and Iran’s Retaliation
description: Israel attacked Iran early Friday and killed many of the country’s top military leaders and scientists. Iran retaliated with missiles and drones.
author: Farnaz Fassihi, Aaron Boxerman, Ephrat Livni and Euan Ward
byline: Farnaz Fassihi, Aaron Boxerman, Ephrat Livni, Euan Ward
excerpt: Israel attacked Iran early Friday and killed many of the country’s top military leaders and scientists. Iran retaliated with missiles and drones.

Israel attacked Iran early Friday and killed many of the country’s top military leaders and scientists. Iran retaliated with missiles and drones.

Published June 12, 2025Updated June 13, 2025, 5:55 p.m. ET

The Israeli military launched a wave of airstrikes inside Iran early on Friday, attacking dozens of targets including nuclear sites and wiping out much of the country’s military chain of command.

Iran retaliated on Friday night, firing missiles that struck at least seven sites around Tel Aviv. Explosions were also heard over Jerusalem as missiles streaked overhead.

In the early hours of Saturday, Iranian air defenses in Tehran were trying to repel new Israeli strikes on Iran’s capital, according to the Iranian state news agency IRNA.

The strikes and counter-strikes marked a dramatic escalation in the long-running conflict between two of the most powerful militaries in the Middle East.

What happened in Iran?

Israel attacked at least six military bases and highly secured housing complexes for military commanders around the capital, Tehran, according to four senior Iranian officials.
